security: This document discusses the Warren Commission's work and concerns about its potential bias, as well as the political affiliations of Mark Lane. Exposing these details could reveal sensitive diplomatic communications and potentially damage relationships with Poland or other nations. The document is marked 'TOP SECRET DINAR NO FOREIGN DISSEMINATION'.
summary: An NSA report details a conversation where McCloy discussed the Warren Commission's work with a Polish UN delegation chief, addressing criticism of the commission's impartiality. The report also mentions concerns about Mark Lane's political motivations and affiliations.
summary_one_paragraph: This NSA report, dated January 29, 1964, summarizes a conversation between McCloy and the Polish UN delegation chief concerning criticism of the Warren Commission, particularly from the European press. McCloy assured the Polish representative that he would not allow any distortion of facts but expressed his growing conviction that Oswald acted alone. The report also notes the circulating opinion that the commission is focused on disproving foreign involvement and cautions against trusting Mark Lane, describing him as an unscrupulous politician financed by pro-Chinese groups.
title: MCCLOY DISCUSSED WORK OF WARREN'S COMMISSION WITH POLISH UN DELEGATION CHIEF
